title: (18500) Guadix - 16 Calle Arquitecto Lorenzo Rodríguez
description: Laundry room also open on Sundays with a dryer Parking in front of the street or in the supermarket car park 100m away. Payment only in coins. Wireless

title: (18500) Guadix - 24 Avenida Buenos Aires
description: There are reserved parking spaces for mobile homes in front of the fairground directly on the street. There is a supply and disposal. FRESH WATER RIGHT, TOILET LEFT for rinsing. Toilet disposal ONLY in the lid at the bottom. There is a market on the fairground on Saturday. There is a flea market there on Sunday. The pitch is very close to the Cathedral, supermarkets, bars and restaurants.

title: (18500) Guadix - 2 Calle José Gibert Clols
description:
A gym with swimming pool and sauna. Possibility to use showers. All these included and 5€ per person. 

open 7.00 - 22.00,  Saturday 8-20,  Sunday 8-15, holidays 9-15.00

There is a cafe next to the place.

You can find parking on the stree or near by.

Friendly admin,  knows a little bit english.

title: (18500) Guadix - 27 Avenida Mariana Pineda
description: The whole Ave. Mariana Pieneda has ample parking, mostly on both sides and the signs allow free parking for vehicles up to 5,5 tons.

title: (18500) Guadix - 94 Calle Virgen de Fátima
description: Small car park, large spaces, convenient for walking and reaching the viewpoint overlooking Guadix and its cave houses. Magnificent. I don't know if we can stay overnight there, no prohibition signs but we just spend the afternoon here.

title: (18500) Guadix - 9 Calle Ciudadana Hortensia
description: Suitable water point with two sampling points. Locals fill their drinking water here.

title: (18500) Guadix - 98 Plaza Del Padre Poveda
description: Parking near the caves museum. Free with no signs. Marked bays. Near a look out point for 360 degree views of the caves.

title: (18500) Guadix - 14 Poligono Ue 5. 8
description: Parking area around the sugar bowl. it is an area with street infrastructure but not urbanized. A very quiet and alternative to the motorhome area, from which you can enjoy magnificent views of both Guadix and Sierra Nevada and where you can spend the night without problem. also from here there are several pretty hiking trails crossing the train track that is above on the right.

title: (18500) Guadix - 5 Calle Rosa Martínez Vera
description: Very quiet street side, far from the noise of the area near the cathedral. start hike "mirador fin del mundo"

title: (18500) Guadix - 57 Avenida Mariana Pineda
description: Gladis laundromat close to ALDI, DÍA and Lidl

title: (18500) Guadix - nº5 Calle José Luis de Los Reyes Arenas
title_short: (18500) Guadix - nº5 Calle José Luis de Los Reyes Arenas
description: PS: we are individuals and they took the business from us without questioning :) ———— Lavandería y Empresa de Inserción “LADIS” - Industrial pressing (of insertion) which is also suitable for individuals. Very cost effective for large quantities of laundry. Easy to park in the area and we are 5 minutes from the cuevas district (troglodyte houses). The only other option in town is another laundromat (always shielded, small machines and hard to park, so that's it!). And they're nice too. We forgot to take a picture but the address is very easily found on Map!

address.street: nº5 Calle José Luis de Los Reyes Arenas

title: (18500) Guadix - 6D Urbanizacion Suelo Urb PP3
description: Very quiet esplanade where there is no prohibition sign of any kind, Guadix to Paulenca road, in front of the cemetery, where you can use the toilets when it is open. nearby there are bars, greengrocers and from there you can start the hiking route to the viewpoint of the End of the World, and on the way to Santiago, it is also close to the troglodyte neighborhood.

title: (18500) Guadix - 25 Camino de Lugros
description: Area in the family equestrian center. Excellent family welcome and environment. Very calm. You can take riding lessons. Possibilities of excursions and excursions on horseback, in a carriage, or in 4x4. Visits to the city, cellars and impressive viewpoints The gate is closed but not locked, it's up to you to open and close so that the horses don't go away.

title: (18500) Guadix - 94 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Parking next to the quiet hospital no prohibition spend a night without problems next to the center.

title: (18500) Guadix - Camino Cueva del Monje
description: Snowy slopes to the southwest, parking space for a van. clear pine forest CSome pines are dry and full of small twigs: FIRE HAZARD!!! Occasional runners or mountain bikers. Access: from the southwest only for crazy people without 4x4, easy access from the north. The height of the van is to park in the shade under the pine trees. Please keep clean!

title: (18500) Guadix - 3 Poligono Ius 1
description: Day and night parking. Near the Hotel Abades and Burger King.

title: () Guadix - 3 Poligono UE-P1
description: Place in the middle of a small village, in front of the olive oil museum which also serves as a restaurant. Accessible by van. We stopped here for the night because impossible to climb to the watchtower with the van. Quiet and spacious location apart from the few cars that come to park for the restaurant. Quiet night but still a little wind.

title: (18519) Guadix - 94 Calle Higuera
description: Small car park for 2 to 3 cc in Paulenca. at the start of the circuit of the mirador of the end of the world. 3kms to do, beautiful views. We had lunch, I think we can sleep there.

title: () Purullena -
description: Lieu très calme à l’ombre des pins, nombreuses places disponibles entre les arbres. Accès par un chemin. Conseiller pour les vans.!

title: (18500) Purullena -
description: On the other side of the other spot. We hear less the highway suddenly, under the pines, quiet!

title: () Purullena - Unnamed Road
description: Great place .. very quiet and very shady. Have spent a very quiet night here. An old recreational area full of esplanades to put the caravan in the shade of pines. I see only two problems: the noise of the motorway is heard in the distance and there is an esplanade that is very dirty.

title: (18516) -
description: Various views, each with very little parking. Access on a few km of very bumpy and dusty gravel road. Cross the valley with a lot of momentum. Less suitable in rain / after rain. Only for small vans, not large motorhomes. Make sure you leave everything clean - respect for nature!

title: (18519) Purullena - 25 Calle los Pozos
description: Good pressure, it's drinking water!

title: (18519) Purullena - 2 Calle Veleta
description: Ample and level parking, recommended by locals. Very calm and quiet, ideal for visiting the cave houses.

title: (18519) Purullena - 1 Carretera Granada
description: Parking space along the main street, in the center of the village which is worth the detour. We stayed there during the day to visit it as well as the local museum, located in a cave on 3 levels (the ground floor, inhabited by the owner can also be visited). Opposite the museum, very cheap take-out food. Very pleasant stage on the Granada side with superb views!

title: (18519) Purullena - 5 Carretera Baños Graena
description: Faucet with threaded outlet.

title: (18516) Marchal - 109P Calle Rambla
description: Large flat car park which will apparently be converted into a communal motorhome area. It is before entering the town of Marchal which has in any case a small inn and some pretty viewpoints on the cliffs and caves, walk along, etc. We did not dare to venture further than the village square where we could easily turn around with our 7m CC and park in this square.

title: (18516) Beas de Guadix -
description: This place was like Cappadoccia in Turkey only without the people and Instagram. Incredible, breathtaking view, especially for sunrises & sunsets! Easy space for 20 vans

title: (18516) Beas de Guadix - 51 Calle Rambla
description: Very quiet place. Flat parking with capacity for 3-4 large volume camper. It is located next to the road that goes up to the Mirador del Fin del Mundo (approx 1km uphill) and about 200m from the town with pharmacy and supermarket services.

title: (18516) Beas de Guadix - 2 Calle Rambla
description: Water point, good flow, drinkable. Health !

title: (18517) Graena - 6 Paseo los Caños
description: Quiet place to spend the night, it has a good restaurant in front.

title: (18516) Beas de Guadix - GR-4105
description: Right next to the road but very little traffic. With ramps straight, amazing view! ?

title: (18517) Graena -
description: Picnic area under construction with tables and barbecues

title: (18519) - 87 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Perfect place to make a stop on the shady path and the possibility of buying typical local pottery. It is not advisable to spend the night because it is very lonely and you are stuck to the A-92 highway with the consequent noise. No services

title: (18518) Cogollos de Guadix -
description: Flat space for many cars next to a small lake. Beautiful view into the Sierra Nevada, you can see some 30-40 kilometers. No service, but also no prohibition signs. Please take your trash with you, there are no bins!

title: (18518) Cogollos de Guadix - Unnamed Road
description: A full day in this swamp. It is small but very nice. in summer it runs out of water when used for irrigation.

title: (18517) Lopera -
description: Overnight accommodation after visiting the nearby dam, as there is no overnight stay there, lonely, quiet, no service, only 4x4 when wet, paths for walking (dog) available. We're standing on a level plateau, nice view.

title: (18517) La Peza - GR-3201
description: Recreational area located on a dam. Great views. Mixed parking near a helicopter landing. Quiet and peaceful. No more parking on the other side of a dam. Restaurant 200m. Forbidden to stay the night

title: (18517) La Peza - GR-3201
description: Parking area on the other side of the dam. very nice and accessible. beautiful view, really this dam is beautiful and aesthetic.

title: (18517) - 61 Diseminado Extrarradio
description: Viewpoint near the Francisco Abellán reservoir. Further down there is another viewpoint with better views but more difficult to park as it is tilted. We just park in the same vantage point as it's the only horizontal spot.

title: (18516) Lugros - 33 Calle Agua
description: It is a parking lot in the town of Lugros, at the foot of the Sierra Nevada, 15-20 min from the highway. Quiet site, in summer the pool is open. Ideal for walking, cycling and enjoying nature. In the town square there is a fountain. There is no WC.

title: (18517) Cortes y Graena - Unnamed Road
description: In the curve in front of a lookout point is a small piece of flat terrain with a fantastic view of the Embalse. Great for one night or several days.

title: (18518) Alquife - 90 Agregado Bda. Marquesado
description: Place of maximum tranquility. You can visit the rent mines.

title: (18517) Cortes y Graena - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet place, next to the swamp. TV and telephone poor. Only two or three flat spaces for large AC (one next to a viewpoint before arriving, the other next to the water. no services

title: (18517) La Peza - Unnamed Road
description: Along the Lake Peza accessible by 4x4 and van, no service, very quiet and beautiful sun in the morning

title: (18518) Jerez del Marquesado - 15 GR-5104
description: Parking on the main road. Fairly wide for an motorhome.

title: (18516) Lugros - GR-4105
description: Recreation area with room for several campervans. This place is next to a river. There are barbecue areas with wood and picnic tables, there is also water in a fountain, the village is 1 km away and from here a spectacular hiking trail starts in the fall.

title: (18517) La Peza - GR-4104
description: Beautiful viewpoint over the village of la Peza. The spot is on the side of the road but it’s very quiet and perfect to spend the night. The police came at one point to see who we were, asking us if we were tourists, and as soon as we said yes they left us in peace. I’m not sure what the rule is but they were fine with us parking here for the night.

title: (18517) La Peza - GR-3201
description: If you drive along the dirt roads you come to a great place in the middle of the surrounding mountain slopes. Great view of the gorges. No service, 4x4 an advantage but not a must. LTE III bars near O2 and Tkom da mast. Very calm and remote. Sunshine all day long

title: (18517) La Peza - 104 Avenida Garrido Abellan
description: Beautiful town in the foothills of the Sierra Nevada. many shops, bars, restaurants, bakeries, grocery stores, pub... Beautiful and incredible views of the city. Tables with seats to eat outside... fill up with water, empty gray and black water... all free thanks to the Town Hall.

title: (18870) Gor - 9 Carretera A-92
description: Gas station and cafe restaurant. Good for a stopover or overnight stay. Open 24 hours a day. Quiet parking lot.

title: (18516) Lugros - Unnamed Road
description: Parking area just outside of the national park. incredible views. no services.

title: (18512) La Calahorra - 12 Calle Diseminado
description: Parking area next to the castle of Calahorra, in an esplanade not very well leveled but that can manage. If I add the place is because, despite having a somewhat difficult access, by a somewhat inclined but accessible track, is an absolutely spectacular viewpoint, quiet and quiet to spend both day and night in a fantastic environment.

title: (18512) La Calahorra - 1 Plaza del Ayuntamiento
description: Parking day and night in the plaza of the town hall with free WiFi

title: (18512) La Calahorra - 42 Avenida del Marquesado

title: (18512) La Calahorra - 1 Calle La Zagüela
description: Drinkable water and parking.

title: (18512) La Calahorra - 21 Calle las Alpujarras
description: Parking for the village cemetery, but it is one of the best places to sleep with spectacular views of the city and the impressive Renaissance castle. Very close the best typical restaurants and "tapas", there is also a supermarket. On the parking lot is tap water and containers for depositing garbage.

title: (18180) Diezma - 30 Lugar Peri
description: Service station for one night, very large parking, few trucks and a nice restaurant, we took water with the permission of the station, do not forget to ask if you want to get thrown by emptying

title: (18512) La Calahorra - 17A Calle las Viñas
description: drinking fountain

title: (18518) Lanteira - 38-48 Calle Altozano
description: Good place to sleep and spend the day, next to the football field. You can see Sierra Nevada in all its splendor, besides a cow farm; you can see goats and horses as welln. Routes to bike and hiking. Very calm.

title: (18513) Ferreira - A-337
description: Quiet place where you can spend the night

title: (18870) Gor - 14 Calle Fuente
description: Great fresh drinking water. there is a small supermarket a couple blocks away and a couple restaurants. some streets are VERY narrow so take be careful. there should be access for everyone though if you avoid those streets so look at the map first.

title: (18512) La Calahorra - A-337
description: Beautiful location under the trees with a view of the snowy mountain peaks. Right on the main road but the road is very quiet. Even 4G connection!

title: (18517) La Peza - Unnamed Road
description: At the end of a secondary track

title: (18512) Dólar - A-92
description: Next to the restaurant, open 24 hours a day, open water, ideal for exploring the Marquesado de Zenete.

title: (18514) Aldeire - Unnamed Road
description: Picnic area. Spacious parking. Stone chairs and tables. Hiking trails. Quiet and very beautiful site. Just pecnoctar. do not remove camping elements. you have to go through narrow streets. just camper ..

title: (18517) La Peza -
description: Parking next to the road. There are trash cans and barbecues with tables. Nice water source. There is a PR that arrives at the town of La Peza.

title: (18512) Dólar - 7 Calle Escuelas
description: Quiet place with sports facilities, playgrounds. ideal for hiking along the northern side of Sierra Nevada. the night is a bit lonely, but it's a city where there are no problems.

title: (18512) Dólar - 12 Calle Henchidero
description: Quiet and flat site, 2 minutes from the town hall

title: (18518) Jerez del Marquesado -
description: La Tizná Recreational Area. A beautiful and quiet place in the surroundings of Jerez del Marquesado, one of the most beautiful villages in the Sierra de Guadix. You have to do 9.7km on unpaved track. We have gone to a Ford Transit and slowly without problem. Not recommended for AC. Shaded area and flat thatched parking lots. We spent one night in August with no problem. We saw foxes in the wild. To access follow the track from the town of Jerez del Marquesado, ask for the camp and they will tell you. The path recommended by Google Maps is impractical.

title: (18540) Huélago - GR-4102
description: Good place to stay outside the village of Huélago. Near the road, but little traffic, that is barely audible. Recreation area under pine trees.

title: (18513) Ferreira - A-337
description: Superb parking place of the viewpoint Mirador del Marquesado. There are flat and slightly sloping parking places. it is very quiet here and you've got an amazing view overlooking the valley and mountains. No toilets and trash bins, so please take your waste with you. There are no signs that an overnight stay is forbidden. In December there was noone else here. Very good mobile 4G coverage.

title: (18860) Guadix - Mirador del Llano de Olivares
title_short: (18860) Guadix - Mirador del Llano de Olivares
description: Parking near the two hundred Dolmens de Gorafe. An excellent site.

title: (18512) Huéneja - A-92
description: Service station with very clean toilets where it is possible to fill up your water tank for free. Please refuel at the same time!

title: (18860) Guadix - Mirador del Llano de Olivares
title_short: (18860) Guadix - Mirador del Llano de Olivares
description: And just where we turned from the horrible path that was there we stopped. In the end we spent the night there and it was not bad at all. Nice sunset. Quiet place but sometimes 4x4 pass very fast on the road.

title: (18540) Huélago - A-401
description: Quiet place to sleep, rest, there is a very cozy bar open at 7.30, close, depends on the clientele, eats very well, also luxury breakfast,

title: (18513) Ferreira - A-337
description: Easy access with a little off road.. Spectacular view, no shade, very windy..

title: (18890) Gorafe - 1B Calle Granada
description: Old washhouse with drinking water tap located just behind the big rosemary bush (small flow)

title: (18890) Gorafe - 1 Calle la Mina
description: It has no services. visit the megalithic center, the dolmens and especially the viewpoint of the coloraos in the park of the quaternary. the nights are spectacular has hardly any light pollution.

title: (18890) Gorafe -
description: Small parking bay for vans when the other spaces are occupied. beautiful view and with a clear sky, wonderful starry nights.

title: (18890) Gorafe - n4 Plaza de la Constitución
title_short: (18890) Gorafe - n4 Plaza de la Constitución
description: Good, accessible water point, right on the village square.

title: (18890) Gorafe - Camino de Bácor
description: Nature site with 360 degree panoramic view near the radio tower of Gorafe. Pure nature!! On the way there are many of the dolmens and the way to the thermal bath in Alicun is also very nice.

title: (18890) Gorafe - 1 Calle Alhambra
description: Gorafe caravan area. All the services.

title: (18512) Huéneja -
description: Parking de la piscine municipale, à l'écart du village. pas de réglementation affichée. calme.

title: (18160) Cortijada Dehesa del Calvario -
description: Useful roadside place to go for a technical hike to Los Lavaderos de le Reina. Forbidden to sleep there, is located in the natural park area. 20-minute dirt mountain path, only accessible for 4x4s and small campers.

title: (18870) - 55 Agregado Valdiquin
description: Beautiful place with beautiful views in the countryside at great calm

title: (18513) Ferreira - A-337
description: Parking with garbage cans

title: (18800) Baza - s/n N-342
description: A parking next to the road and next to a small motel/ restaurant. Ok for a night

title: (18890) Gorafe -
description: Parking by the side of the road, very peaceful. Magnificent 360 view.

title: (18517) Quéntar - GR-3201
description: Nice spot on the side of the road with very little traffic. There was some trash when we arrived that we picked up, try to do the same if you can!

title: (18890) Gorafe - GR-6100
description:
A level gravel bay, similar to the others along this road. This one is sheltered by rock on 3 sides. Perfect for when the wind is a bit too strong to be out in the open.
No paths or attractions, just a secluded quiet spot for the night.

title: (18514) Aldeire - A-337
description: Exelent ice cold drinking water :)

title: (18890) Gorafe - GR-6100
description: Next to a quiet road, flat land that can accommodate 2 or 3 vehicles. Magnificent view. No service.

title: (18539) Villanueva de las Torres - GR-6101
description: In the spa car park, ideal for visiting the petroglyphs, the dolmens, the Toril aqueduct, the megalithic interpretation center of Gorafe.

title: (18539) Villanueva de las Torres - GR-6101
description: Near the hot spring.

title: (18539) Villanueva de las Torres -
description: Small flat place next to a path 20m from the GR6100. We spent a beautiful night in a beautiful and peaceful environment

title: (18890) Gorafe - Unnamed Road
description: Desert of Gorafe, along the track. Stunning and calm view. Small promontory that allows to be sheltered from the morning sun. Access in T5.

title: (18530) Pedro Martínez - 8 Plaza Santa Cruz
description: Beautiful town with beautiful mountain hiking trails, good tapas. Parking on the town hall square.

title: (18890) Gorafe - Unnamed Road
description: In the middle of nowhere in the middle of nowhere, absolute tranquility and silence, accessible with a motorhome with enhanced traction or 4x4, otherwise do not venture on the track, it is sometimes in poor condition, with steep slopes

title: (18890) Gorafe -
description: Please note that this site is reserved for aesthetes and perfectionists! Surely my most beautiful spot of the year. Spot set back from the main track which is otherwise very uncrowded. Go straight on the motorable track that starts from the megalite car park before Gorafe, in the direction of los Coloraos for 9km, small branch on the right, it's flat, no need for wedges.

title: (18160) Güéjar Sierra -
description: Flat corner of land with breathtaking views of the mountains. Is used as a parking lot for hikes by the locals. Forbidden to sleep there because it is located at the entrance to the natural park. The paved road ends at the entrance to the natural park, where there are a few places to park but not flat. To get to the spot, 200-300 meters of dirt road. Place in the middle of nature, thank you for respecting this magnificent place.

title: (04500) Fiñana - Unnamed Road
description: Stopped here for lunch. Idyllic spot with lovely view.m. We parked our motor home  to the left before passing the bridge. Enough space to turn around there. Follow the paved road over the bridge and pass the cottages to find yourself on a nice hiking route. Not sure where it leads, but has the yellow/white stripes hiking route marking. Totally worth it to venture into the forest from here or stay the night and add a hiking adventure followed by a jump in the water reserve. Enjoy!

title: (18800) Gor - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful site, surrounded by nature and at 2000m, with a high mountain feeling. The access setting is quite good even after the visitor center. Without about 12 km from the highway, but it is worth it. Tranquility, mountain goats, scots pine forest and very beautiful routes that start from the same place as the car park.

title: (18517) Tocón de Quéntar - Cam. de Quéntar a La Peza
title_short: (18517) Tocón de Quéntar - Cam. de Quéntar a La Peza
description:
Nice picnic area with 4 individual small spots.

At the front and at the very back there is the possibility to fill up drinking water from natural sources (only in canisters/cans etc.).

A large garbage can is located at the entrance on the main road.

No cell phone reception or internet.

address.street: Cam. de Quéntar a La Peza

title: (18517) Tocón de Quéntar -
description: Without services right land it is not easy to access but it is worth it. Please take the trash with you.

title: (18800) Baza - N-342
description: In the Jazz Park, a few pitches for a quiet night. the park guards passed without questioning us. the deeper we go to the interpretation center, the more the forest atmosphere sets in.

title: (18860) Baúl -
description: Old quarry near the Cortijo de Narváez and visitor center of the Sierra de Baza. From there you can go out and do several hiking routes, such as the climb to the Narváez viewpoint. With luck and patience you can see animals in the park. In the center they recommend going up to Prados del Rey.

title: (18890) Villanueva de las Torres - Camino de los Campos Mones
title_short: (18890) Villanueva de las Torres - Camino de los Campos Mones
description: Views in the nowhere close to Gorafe, where there are over 200 dolmens. Very quiet and lonely. Access for large vehicles not suitable. 4 x 4 with access from Gorafe/Guadix at least in bad weather advantage, Villanueva de las Torres sis imperative (particularly after rain dangerous). The route is scenic eunderschön!  No facilities.

title: (18800) Baza - Unnamed Road
description: Parking of the information center and restaurant

title: (18539) Villanueva de las Torres - 22-24 Calle Almazara
title_short: (18539) Villanueva de las Torres - 22-24 Calle Almazara
description: Esplanade in the center of the city. You can't park here or next to the sports field, but the streets are narrow. The city is beautiful.

title: (18183) Huétor Santillán - A-4004
description: Ideal to stop to eat on the road. Next to the highway but secluded, ideal natural environment, Sierra de Huétor Natural Park.

title: (18860) Olivar -
description: Beautiful place with a great view. Easily accessible for 4x4 with ground clearance (the driveway was dusty and dry for me - it can be a bit more difficult to reach when wet) - about 20 meters after the turning loop, relatively flat and good to stand for one night. Hardly any traffic and when it gets dark it is completely lonely. No service, but LTE reception. Attention, the terrain is partly very steep - danger of falling when walking at night, but a beautiful starry sky.

title: (18192) Quéntar - GR-3201
description: Small parking dam, road not too busy !! Very beautiful landscape. Very good for one night.

title: (18192) Quéntar - GR-3201
description: Beautiful location with magnificent views. When taking photos, there were two mountain goats. The village is a few kilometers away. In the picnic area there is a source of very cool water.

title: (04500) Fiñana -
description: Spot after 1km500 on a flat forest track, alone in the world, quiet night. We heard only one car passing in the morning.

title: (18183) Huétor - Santillán - Unnamed Road
description: Sierra de Huetor, water fountains, barbecues, hiking trails and a special path for the disabled. In the nearby town (Prado Negro) there are restaurants that serve very good cuisine and right next to it begins a path that reaches a very beautiful small waterfall. "Please respect the environment and its rules, do not take out chairs, tables, or what can be considered camping, we are in a natural park and what that entails, enough that they let us spend the night for now" LET'S TAKE CARE OF THIS.

title: (18160) Güejar Sierra - Vereda de La Estrella
title_short: (18160) Güejar Sierra - Vereda de La Estrella
description: We went to the Vereda de las Estrellas and they told us that there were parking lots about 50 meters away. We entered the camper and we were allusifs the nice place to sleep. There is no sign of forbidden anywhere, so we decided to spend the night next to the flow of the river and the sound of the water. Great quiet area we were just saying camp. There is a restaurant very close to what is called the San Juan ravine.

title: () Villanueva de las Torres - Camino de los Campos Mones
title_short: () Villanueva de las Torres - Camino de los Campos Mones
description: Probably one of the most beautiful places to spend a night !!! Calm, seclusion, Nature in its raw state. Accessible by gravel path of about 12 km from the village of Villanueva de Las Torres. Vehicle therefore suitable (4x4, crossover or small vehicle with good traction on hills !!! Breathtaking view !!!

title: (18160) Güejar Sierra - 1 Carretera Fuente la Teja Argumosa
title_short: (18160) Güejar Sierra - 1 Carretera Fuente la Teja Argumosa
description: Nice and safe place by a restaurant. Nice hosts, good food and many opportunities for hiking.

title: (04500) Fiñana - Unnamed Road
description: Esplanade just behind the sawmill at the foot of the Sierra Nevada. Ideal to rest one night and continue the trip the next day, since it is quite close to the highway (you cannot hear it). Pretty level. With mobile and TV coverage. Nice views. Very quiet area even if you go with dogs. No shade during the day and no bins. To get there it is a dirt road but short and easy. A few meters away are the sports facilities of the town of Fiñana (swimming pool in summer). Let's respect these sites!

title: (18860) Bácor - 2 Calle Negratín
description: Water fountain and outdoor gym..

title: (18539) Villanueva de las Torres -
description: Bivouac at the Los Coloraos viewpoint in the Gorafe desert. Spectacular view and only night in the world

title: (18183) Huétor - Santillán - Unnamed Road
description: Authorized place for controlled camping (Florencia), ideal for visiting the Sierra de Huetor

title: (18184) Beas de Granada -
description: Not far from the motorway, coming from the coast 20 km before Granada, 1,350 m above sea level - (on 17.5.23 fresh 9° at night). Absolute calm. Only ideal for overnight stays and onward travel. Access without problems. Vehicles up to 7.50m ok to turn.

title: (18494) - A-337
description: Spot with beautiful view of the valley. Attention bivouac only out of season. At the foot of the lookout "el picacho". No service. Thank you for leaving the place clean.

title: (18183) Huétor Santillán - A-92
description: Rest area at the exit of the motorway.

title: (04479) Bayárcal - AL-5402
description: Parking for Motorhomes, with playground for children, bar, bicycle rental and zip line. There are not many shadows.

title: (18568) Píñar - 52 Calle Real
description: Parking lot next to the main street of the city. Easy access, unpaved ground, space for 3 vehicles. Quiet area with no services ideal for visiting the village and the cave of the windows

title: (18160) Güejar Sierra - A-4030
description: Siding on the road. Very few cars pass by so it's not noisy. It is not totally flat but almost. Nice views of Güejar Sierra. To spend a night on the road, it's fine

title: (18160) Güejar Sierra - 5 A-4030
description: Nice place next to the road. not too far from another site further down, but some reviews say they can be difficult to get to with some motorhomes. parked overnight and 2 other trucks showed up. No problem and 5 min walk to fresh water lake for swimming.

title: (18160) Güejar Sierra - Calle Camino Sotillejo
description:
Beautiful view of the reservoir and mountains. We only stopped for lunch so not sure if you can stay the night. We parked in a lay-by. There is a disused railway line for hiking and cycling. The town of Gujar Sierra is a base for accessing the mountains. Possibility of swimming in the reservoir. 
Not a through road so you need to be able to turn around, 6m van may be the maximum in order to turn.

title: (18160) Güejar Sierra - 7 Calle Pico Del Goterón
title_short: (18160) Güejar Sierra - 7 Calle Pico Del Goterón
description: Water point with tap, rubbish bin

title: (18160) Güejar Sierra - 2 Avenida Libertad
description: Bus parking next to the sports hall of Guejar Sierra. Place near the start of the Vereda de la Estrella route, regular buses to Granada.

title: (18160) Güejar Sierra - 11 Calle Camino Sotillejo
description: Quiet site next to the reservoir, between mountains, narrow road, not suitable for large caravans, hiking trails and restaurants at 10min

title: (18538) Dehesas de Guadix - 19 Calle 28 de Febrero
title_short: (18538) Dehesas de Guadix - 19 Calle 28 de Febrero
description: Parking above the village on a quiet street.

title: (18192) Quéntar - Calle S. Sebastian
description: Parking for small vans. No mobile homes!! We fit perfectly with 5.5m. Very narrow streets in this village. Nice view from the parking lot and public WiFi. Only park in the marked parking spaces, otherwise they will be towed away when the bus tries to turn around.

title: (18160) Güejar Sierra - Unnamed Road
description:
Placette at the edge of the road that goes down to the reservoir, possibility of parking in the bend just above, but with a much less beautiful view! the road is an impressive mountain road, can be complicated for a big vehicle, is doing very well with a Mercedes Vito!
Don't follow Google. Take the North side of the lake from Granada otherwise to narrow for campers. (2.5m width)

title: (18538) Dehesas de Guadix - 67 Avenida Constitucion
description: It is the only place where I found parking in the village. It's a bit lonely but the city is calm.

title: (18183) Huétor Santillán -
description: Space where it is possible to park several vehicles, is a few meters from a forest house but we and another van have not had any problem spending the night there. Very quiet, surrounded by trees and in the morning you can walk 4km to the viewpoint.

title: (18192) Quéntar -
description: Approach only recommended in van! The place has extremely narrow and steep streets! Drinking water source directly at the bus stop. You can stop in the garbage behind him for a short time.

title: (18196) - Carretera Hoya de la Mora
description: Parking Hoya de la Mora 10 minutes above the ski resort of Sierra Nevada. Altitude 2550 m. Ideal starting point for the ascent of the Veleta (3496 m).

title: (18494) Laroles - A-337
description: Gravel pitch for an overnight stay with a view of the valley. Although it is on the road, it is hardly used at night. Maybe 5 cars passed. If this place is not flat enough for you, there is a second bay about 100m further up the mountain.

title: (18196) Monachil -
description: At the end of the authorized road. Small platform.

name: Camper Park Beas de Granada
title: (18184) Camper Park Beas de Granada
description:
Camper Park Beas de Granada.

Overnight area located in the Sierra de Huétor Natural Park, just 18 km from Granada.
With bus stop to Granada capital at the door €1.80 ticket.
Guarded, showers, toilet, washing machine, dryer, wifi, drinking water throughout the premises.
With services within walking distance of restaurants, supermarkets, pharmacy,...
Where you will enjoy a privileged environment, with a multitude of hiking and mountain bike routes.

title: (18196) Monachil - 150 Urbanizacion Solynieve
description: Parking on the side of the road, near Los Peñones car park, now limited in height.

title: (18196) Monachil - Carretera Hoya de la Mora
title_short: (18196) Monachil - Carretera Hoya de la Mora
description: Small parking area 100m below main Hoya de la Mora car park.  Amazing views.

title: (18160) Güejar Sierra - A-4025
description: Not completely flat, but quite far up the mountains!

title: (18192) Quéntar - 12 Poligono UE-1
description: Close to the road, large plots at the entrance of the village

title: (18184) Beas de Granada - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet place in the countryside

title: (04479) Bayárcal - AL-5402
description: Parking at the entrance to the village. Overlooking the valley. Superb view. Very calm and safe. Pretty village on the mountainside.

title: (18196) Monachil - 513 Grupo Prado Alto
description: Parking day and night. Free. We spent the night 3 AC and 3 campers. Where you take the chairlift to Pradollano. And right where the bus stops. quiet at night. Recommended to be free although without services. From 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. paying!

name: Camping Las Lomas
title: (18160) Camping Las Lomas
description: The campsite is exceptionally well maintained. The sanitary facilities are not new, but in very good condition and very clean. We noticed that the entire place is maintained with great attention to detail. We feel very comfortable. Directly from the campsite there is a bus to Granada every hour, about 40 minutes. The last bus from Granada at 22:30 (weekdays). The place is scenically impressive and is absolutely quiet. Just perfect

title: (18196) Monachil - 49 Urbanizacion Solynieve
description: New large motorhome parking in the Sierra Nevada. View over the ski area. No service except trash cans. In high season 5 euros per night. There is a bus that goes to Pradollano and the ski lifts every 20 mins. 20 min walk to village.

title: (18800) Baza - GR-8101
description: Flat gravel parking with nice view. Very quiet, not windy, in one side covered by rocks and old stone building.

title: (18196) Sierra Nevada - 13 Calle de la Virgen de las Nieves
title_short: (18196) Sierra Nevada - 13 Calle de la Virgen de las Nieves
description: Self-service laundry Sierra Nevada

address.street: 13 Calle de la Virgen de las Nieves

title: (18160) Granada - A-4025
description: Good place with beautiful views, very quiet and close to several houses.

name: Camping Alto de Viñuelas
title: (18184) Camping Alto de Viñuelas
description: Camping Alto de Viñuelas - nice campsite not far off the motorway. Site quiet out of season which meant we could get our 10metre bus on! Don't know how possible this would be if it was busy. The restaurant served great home cooked food (real chips!)

title: (18196) Monachil - 3 Urbanizacion Solynieve
description: In winter, it is better to climb to the next rest area. It is next to all the services of the winter season, restaurants, etc., in summer, there are many activities and to operate lifts to reach the summits.

title: (18193) Monachil - A-4025
description: Beautiful place, right in the entrance of a hiking circuit, peaceful and quiet, with a forest and snow to play on winter, looks nice to stay at night, with a van or an motorhome.

title: (18160) Güejar Sierra - A-4025
description: Good vantage point and flat parking lot. I spent a very quiet night here alone, I slept well. Beautiful sunsets and views. I woke up to a bright sun, although I imagine it will be cold if not for the high altitude. Large vans will have a difficult time accessing it due to a barrier in the road. It is fine for VW size vans but not much larger.

title: (18160) Güejar Sierra - A-4025
description: Parking to the viewing platform. Within sight of the branch line to Pico Veleta. No traffic or parkers at night. Difficult access for large campers. Currently the access road above and below is closed (one-way street sign on both sides).

title: (18196) Sierra Nevada - A-395
description: Parking for both cars and Camper and AC. I was on 12/31 and 1/1/2022 and very quiet. There are no services whatsoever. They say they charge a day. PradoLlano 15 minutes walk. Good place to spend the night. You have to go early.

title: (18196) Sierra Nevada - A 395
description: Free parking, along a main road. Day and night parking with a beautiful view of the snowy mountains. There are no services available. The winter sports village of Pradollano is half an hour away on foot, 15 minutes by bike. There is a small supermarket for essentials, shops and restaurants and terraces.

title: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - 1 Vial Camino
description: Just off the road at the entrance to Club Náutico Negratin. Nothing here at all but a nice view of the reservoir.

title: (18183) Huétor Santillán - 25 Urbanizacion Suelo Urb. PP4
title_short: (18183) Huétor Santillán - 25 Urbanizacion Suelo Urb. PP4
description: Service area found by chance which was very quiet and very convenient. Possibility of having breakfast on the spot

title: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - 1 Calle Presa del Negratin
title_short: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - 1 Calle Presa del Negratin
description: Embalse del Negratin Superb view of the dam bar in season picnic table calm at night length of the motorhome maximum 7'50 meters

title: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - 1 Calle Presa del Negratin
title_short: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - 1 Calle Presa del Negratin
description: Magnificent view of the dam

name: Alpujarras Camping
title: (18494) Alpujarras Camping
description: Camping Alpujarras: Beautiful campsite, very quiet with a breathtaking view, warm welcome, Tino gave us very good tips and was always there for us. Sanitary clean, hot water available, nothing to complain about. We'd love to come back.

title: (18192) Dúdar - 1 Barranco Fiñana
description: Small quiet town, the river passes nearby.

title: (04479) Bayárcal - AL 5402
description: Very quiet, next to a cemetery, slightly sloping.

title: (18494) Andalusia - 33 A-4130
description: Area of coarse gravel with trees. Very nice views to the Valley

title: (18470) Válor - s/n Torrecilla
description: Parking next to a viewpoint on the outskirts of town. Very quiet to spend the night and with good views. The bad thing is that there is no shade

title: (18494) Laroles - 1 A-337
description: Esplanade next to the Laroles gas station. It is one of the few places where you can stop. beautiful views.

title: () Monachil - A-395
description: Don Manuel Fountain, very rich water in the Sierra Nevada. Please clean the environment.

title: (18812) Freila - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet parking space on a platform with access to the water. Quiet, clean and fantastic view. Clean up waste and toilet paper and keep it tidy. Otherwise this place will be closed in no time.

title: (18470) Válor - A-4130
description: La Casa de Lareda, very small car park of 5 motorhomes maximum with an exceptional panoramic view. Very warm welcome by English speaking owners. Pool and bar with drinks at very good prices

title: (18470) Válor - 12 Barrio Torrecilla
description: Quiet, flat parking near a hermitage and an ideal park for children

title: (04520) Abrucena - 11 Diseminado Abrucena
description: We spent a very quiet night in this place. The town is beautiful and very welcoming.

title: (18417) Trevélez - Unnamed Road
description: Parking area. There is no indication regarding the night. This area is next to the river, next to a cow farm. Very quiet area, ideal for walking dogs.

name: Camping Rural La Cabañuela **
title: (18812) Camping Rural La Cabañuela **
description: This large campsite is not far (about 5 km) from the small town of Freila, where there are some cafes, bars, a bank and a supermarket. From the square you can see the beautiful lake - Embalse del Nigratin - where you can swim, SUP and kayak. The small campsite has shaded areas and sanitary facilities in good condition. The pool is where you meet the locals who come here to swim. The staff are very friendly, helpful and competent and make the stay very special.

title: (18460) Yegen - Unnamed Road
description: Superb view of the Sierra Nevada. 30 seconds from the main road, flat.

title: (18191) Canales - GR-3200
description: Tarred pitch above the dam with a magnificent view of the lake. very few cars passing at night we were not disturbed! motorhome access possible, it is very wide. No prohibition signs for the night.

title: (18191) Güejar Sierra - 9 Calle Canales
description: Esplanade paved with good views and very quiet, with a football field and possibility of roads, it is forbidden to park on the facade of the Hydrographic Confederation but in the rest it is possible.

title: (18520) El Hacho - Unnamed Road
description: Worth seeing at the old iron bridge station

title: (04520) Abrucena - 112 Calle Tarrasa
description: Village fountain and trash cans

title: (18160) Güejar Sierra - A-395
description: Access sloping by the road, follow the path and we arrive on a great grassy site, view of the mountain, we are invisible from the road possible to turn around for van only I think (T5 long)

title: (18183) Huétor Santillán - GR-3103
description: Secret place

title: (18812) Freila - Unnamed Road
description: Pantano de freila, is an outdoor area with a marsh and playground for games.

title: (18812) Freila - Unnamed Road
description: Continuing to the right of the small restaurant, there is a small stone path that leads to the lake with a turquoise water with a magnificent view of the mountains, absolute calm, the only one in the world at the end of May, advice: attention soil furniture and wholesale pebbles! I recommend that in the SUV (we had a lot of trouble out with a T5 !!! Because big climb and unstable ground we skated well)

title: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - Camino de Negretín
title_short: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - Camino de Negretín
description: A nice little corner for a midday meal, I'm there, and maybe for one night but not tested. No service.

title: (18196) Sierra Nevada -
description: Parking spot next to the road. It is flat enough to sleep and you have the most amazing view. The road can be a bit busy, lots of people going to the ski-resort. However for one night looking out at the Pico Veleta and a gourgeous sunset, worth it!

title: (04520) Abrucena - 5 Camino Acequia Nueva
description: Small car park next to the tourist office. Maximum 6 motorhomes. Very quiet at night. Nice town with hiking trails through the Alpujarra of Almeria

title: (18183) - Av. de Puente Nuevo
description: Water tap with hose connection.

title: (04479) Paterna del Río - AL-5402
description: Nice quiet parking with view of the surrounding mountains. Great 4g reception. Recently renovated with new athletic equipment.

title: () Canales -
description: A 1500mt altitude platform over a valley, some rocks on the path but 50mt from a asphalt road. Slightly windy, very calm and with an amazing view. Perfect place in the summer. Might be private. *please leave this place clean♻️?*

title: (18183) Huétor Santillán - 1 Barrio Cueva Señor
description: Parking to make the path of the birth of the darro.

name: Área de autocaravanas de Abla-Montagón
title: (04510) Área de autocaravanas de Abla-Montagón
description: Area in ABLA (MONTAGÓN). Municipal land located about 2 km. from the city of Abla in Montagón Park. Maximum stay of 48 hours.

title: (18450) Mecina Bombarón - 60 Avenida Jose Antonio Bravo
title_short: (18450) Mecina Bombarón - 60 Avenida Jose Antonio Bravo
description: Terrace next to a small street overlooking the valley. Small space, suitable for a van.

title: (18417) Trevélez - 50 Calle Carretera
description: Parking area at the exit of the town of Trevélez, next to the riverbed with bathing area, is high, there is no danger of flooding, very clean and fresh water, quiet area with influx to bathing area

title: (18417) Trevélez - 4 Calle Pista Barrio Medio
description: Parking at Valdelinares, the capital of the ham and also the highest village in Spain.
